intro: Lepidaploa macahensis, commonly known as the Mexican lepidaploa, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in dense clusters. Lepidaploa macahensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
